SENT.plain: We describe a male patient with Behcet's syndrome and Castleman's lymphadenopathy
He was affected by severe oral and genital ulcers, bilateral uveitis, necrotic purulent nodules on both hands
A CT scan of the mediastinum showed the presence of a mediastinal mass
On the basis of histological and immunohistological findings, a diagnosis of Castleman's disease, angiofollicular type, was formulated
After the surgical excision of the mediastinal mass (January, 1989) until now, Behcet's syndrome is in complete remission with a low dosage of prednisone
